page.title: 15BUILDINGS R PARTRIDGE
page.content: The village of Gittisham is just off the old Fosse way to the West of Honiton. Most of the houses are thatched and were originally occupied by workers on the Marker Estate. About 30 years ago the council built 4 houses and later 4 bungalows for old age pensioners. Three of the four houses are now privately owned. There has been only one house built since then, it was built by 'Devon Lady' a local firm. At the moment a farm-yard is being converted into 4 houses, 2 flats and some workshops. Every year we organise a Guy Fawkes night, the mums make the food, the dads organise the fireworks, the children collect rubbish for the fire and make the Guy. Every Tuesday a shopping bus takes people to Honiton. This is the only public transport we have.
